segment.source: About the Sequencer Console
segment.target: About the Sequencer Console

segment.source: About the Sequencer Console
segment.target: About the Sequencer Console

segment.source: About the Sequencer Console
segment.target: About the Sequencer Console

segment.source: Before you start using the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) sequencer, you should be familiar with the following information about the App-V sequencer console.
segment.target: Before you start using the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) sequencer, you should be familiar with the following information about the App-V sequencer console.

segment.source: The following sections describe the tools available in the Sequencer console.
segment.target: The following sections describe the tools available in the Sequencer console.

segment.source: Application Virtualization Sequencer Console Menu Options
segment.target: Application Virtualization Sequencer Console Menu Options

segment.source: The following menu items are available in the App-V Sequencer Console:
segment.target: The following menu items are available in the App-V Sequencer Console:

segment.source: File - Contains various commands to help create, open, modify, and save sequenced applications.
segment.target: File - Contains various commands to help create, open, modify, and save sequenced applications.

segment.source: Edit - Contains various commands for editing existing virtual applications.
segment.target: Edit - Contains various commands for editing existing virtual applications.

segment.source: View - Contains various commands for viewing properties of a virtual application.
segment.target: View - Contains various commands for viewing properties of a virtual application.

segment.source: Tools - Contains various tools and diagnostics for configuring virtual applications.
segment.target: Tools - Contains various tools and diagnostics for configuring virtual applications.

segment.source: Application Virtualization Sequencer Console Toolbar Options
segment.target: Application Virtualization Sequencer Console Toolbar Options

segment.source: The following toolbar buttons are available in the App-V Sequencer Console:
segment.target: The following toolbar buttons are available in the App-V Sequencer Console:

segment.source: New Package - Click to create a new sequenced application.
segment.target: New Package - Click to create a new sequenced application.

segment.source: Open - Click to open a sequenced application package in the App-V Sequencer Console.
segment.target: Open - Click to open a sequenced application package in the App-V Sequencer Console.

segment.source: Open for Upgrade - Click to open a sequenced application to upgrade or apply an update.
segment.target: Open for Upgrade - Click to open a sequenced application to upgrade or apply an update.

segment.source: Save - Click to save a sequenced virtual application.
segment.target: Save - Click to save a sequenced virtual application.

segment.source: Sequencing Wizard - Click to open the Sequencing Wizard.
segment.target: Sequencing Wizard - Click to open the Sequencing Wizard.

segment.source: You should use this button to start the Sequencing Wizard if you make any changes on the General tab under ToolsOptions.
segment.target: You should use this button to start the Sequencing Wizard if you make any changes on the General tab under ToolsOptions.

segment.source: Virtual Application Tabs
segment.target: Virtual Application Tabs

segment.source: The following tabs are displayed when you view a virtual application in the App-V Sequencer Console:
segment.target: The following tabs are displayed when you view a virtual application in the App-V Sequencer Console:

segment.source: Properties - Displays information about the selected virtual application.
segment.target: Properties - Displays information about the selected virtual application.

segment.source: You can update the Package Name and Comments associated with the virtual application.
segment.target: You can update the Package Name and Comments associated with the virtual application.

segment.source: Deployment - Displays information about how the virtual application will be accessed by target computers.
segment.target: Deployment - Displays information about how the virtual application will be accessed by target computers.

segment.source: You can configure the virtual application delivery method, and you can configure which operating systems must be running on the target computer.
segment.target: You can configure the virtual application delivery method, and you can configure which operating systems must be running on the target computer.

segment.source: You can also configure the associated output options.
segment.target: You can also configure the associated output options.

segment.source: If you plan to have clients access a virtual application from a file, use the following format when specifying the path: File://server/share/path/.sft.
segment.target: If you plan to have clients access a virtual application from a file, use the following format when specifying the path: File://server/share/path/.sft.

segment.source: Select Enforce Security Descriptors to preserve security associated with the package during an upgrade, or the permissions will be reset during the upgrade.
segment.target: Select Enforce Security Descriptors to preserve security associated with the package during an upgrade, or the permissions will be reset during the upgrade.

segment.source: Change History - Displays information about updates that have been made to the virtual application.
segment.target: Change History - Displays information about updates that have been made to the virtual application.

segment.source: Files - Displays the files associated with the selected virtual application.
segment.target: Files - Displays the files associated with the selected virtual application.

segment.source: You can make minor revisions to the associated file properties by using the appropriate fields.
segment.target: You can make minor revisions to the associated file properties by using the appropriate fields.

segment.source: Virtual Registry - Displays the virtual registry associated with the selected virtual application.
segment.target: Virtual Registry - Displays the virtual registry associated with the selected virtual application.

segment.source: You can add or delete registry keys by right-clicking the appropriate entry.
segment.target: You can add or delete registry keys by right-clicking the appropriate entry.

segment.source: Virtual File System - Displays the virtual file systems associated with the selected virtual application.
segment.target: Virtual File System - Displays the virtual file systems associated with the selected virtual application.

segment.source: You can add, delete, or edit file system entries on this tab by right-clicking the appropriate entry and selecting the option.
segment.target: You can add, delete, or edit file system entries on this tab by right-clicking the appropriate entry and selecting the option.

segment.source: Virtual Services - Displays the services associated with the selected virtual application.
segment.target: Virtual Services - Displays the services associated with the selected virtual application.

segment.source: OSD - Displays information about the Open Software Descriptor (OSD) associated with the virtual application.
segment.target: OSD - Displays information about the Open Software Descriptor (OSD) associated with the virtual application.

segment.source: You can update the files associated with the OSD file by right-clicking the appropriate entry and selecting the action that you want.
segment.target: You can update the files associated with the OSD file by right-clicking the appropriate entry and selecting the action that you want.

segment.target: Related topics
